alert.note: Alert for Northern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:56AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Otsego, southeastern Broome, western Delaware, southeastern Chenango, northeastern Susquehanna and northwestern Wayne Counties through 230 AM EDT... At 156 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Morris to near Deposit to near Gibson. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Sidney, Jackson, Walton, Sanford, Colchester, Maryland, Deposit, Susquehanna Depot and Meredith. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 86/Route 17 between 82 and 90. Interstate 88 between 9 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
